#labels Featured,Installation
= Installation =

Robotframework Eclipse Library is based on :
 * robotframework v2.1.3
 * python v2.6
 * jython v2.2
 * Eclipse 3.5 (should work also on 3.4 but not tested!)
 * SWTBot 2.0
 * Javalib core 0.8.1 with dependencies

Robotframework Eclipse Library v0.7 now works on :
 * robotframework v2.5.3
 * python v2.6
 * jython v2.5.1
 * RIDE v0.27


== Eclipse Plugin ==
 Before using Eclipse Library, you should install a plugin under Eclipse.
 * Robotframework Eclipse Library plugin for SWTBot update site
   [http://scrumvision.sourceforge.net/update-site/eclipselibrary]
 This plugin will ask you installing SWTBot normaly.
 
== Eclipse library ==
 Then download the latest eclipse library jar file.
 * [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework-swinglibrary/downloads/list]
 * Also [http://code.google.com/p/robotframework-javatools/wiki/JavalibCore javalib-core-x.x.x-jar-with-dependencies.jar] should be placed next to EclipseLibrary jar file

 Add Eclipse Library resource file in your test case as a resource.
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/files/EclipseLibraryKeywords.html  EclipseLibraryKeywords.html]

== Some test cases == 
Those test cases are used for unit testing of the library.
You could use it as per exemple.
 * [http://robotframework-eclipselibrary.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/org.lcx.robotframework.eclipselibrary-testcases/]
